question: What shall be the minimum volume in cubic inches for an 8 AWG conductor in a box?
At least one outlet in bathrooms is required to be within what dimension of each lavatory basin?
A receptacle for a cord-and-plug-connected range hood shall be supplied by an individual branch circuit?
Direct buried conductors and cables emerging from the ground shall be protected to a point at least how far above finished grade?
What shall be the minimum burial depth of direct burial cables or conductors in locations not specifically identified?
Electric spa and hot tub water heaters shall be listed and shall have the heating elements subdivided into loads not exceeding ______ amperes?
What shall be the minimum cover for rigid metal conduit installed under a driveway?
Where a branch circuit or a feeder supplies a continuous load it shall have an allowable ampacity equal to or greater than the non-continuous load plus ______ percent of continuous load?
Switches shall not be more than what dimension above a floor or working platform, when in its highest position?
Above-ground service-entrance cables subject to physical damage shall be protected by what schedule PVC conduit?
The minimum headroom for working spaces for service equipment and panel boards shall be how many feet?
What shall be the minimum AWG size copper grounding electrode conductor when the largest ungrounded service entrance conductor for a panel is 1/0 copper?
All circuit conductors between the service equipment, or the source of a separately derived system, or other power supply source and the final branch-circuit overcurrent device.
Flexible cords for kitchen range hoods shall have what minimum and maximum length?

Outdoor receptacles that are not readily accessible and are supplied from a dedicated branch circuit for electric snow-melting or deicing equipment shall be permitted to be installed without ground-fault circuit-interrupter protection for personnel?
Unused cable and raceway openings in cabinets and panel boards shall be effectively ______ to afford protection equivalent to that of the wall cabinet?
How many 15 or 20 amp receptacles supplied by a general purpose branch circuit shall be located a minimum of 6 feet from and not more than 20 feet from the inside walls of pools?
A luminaire that weighs more than ______ or exceeds 16 inches in any dimension shall not be supported by the screws of a lamp holder?
Underground service laterals that are not encased in concrete and that are buried 18 inches or more below grade shall have their location identified by what?
Recessed incandescent fixtures shall have what kind of protection?
Where raceways are installed in wet locations above grade, the interior of such raceways shall be considered to be a ______ location.
Where installed in raceways, conductors of what size AWG and larger shall be stranded?
Threaded bonding connections at a service shall be fastened how tight?
Flexible cords for kitchen waste disposals shall be what dimension?

All 15 and 20 amp, single phase, 125-volt receptacles located within ______ feet of the inside walls of pools and outdoor spas and hot tubs shall be protected by a Class A ground-fault circuit-interrupter?
Where used outside, aluminum or copper-clad aluminum grounding conductors shall not be terminated within ______ inches of the earth?
Generally, ceiling suspended paddle fans shall be supported independently of outlet boxes when weighing over 50 lbs?
A minimum of one ___ -ampere-rated branch circuit shall be provided for receptacles located in the laundry area and shall serve only receptacle outlets in the laundry area.
Cords that supply swimming pool equipment shall have a copper equipment grounding conductor not smaller than what AWG?
For one-family dwellings, the rating of the ungrounded conductors shall be not less than how many amperes three wire?
All parts of a pool required to be bonded shall be bonded together with a copper conductor not smaller than what AWG?
The underground service conductors between the electric utility supply system and the service point.
A branch circuit using 14 AWG conductors and a 15 Ampere overcurrent-protection device shall have a maximum load rating of how many amps?

Equipment grounding conductors of sizes 6 AWG and smaller shall be identified by a continuous green color or a continuous green color with one or more ______ stripes on the insulation or covering, except where bare?

The common point on a wye-connection in a polyphase system or midpoint on a single-phase, 3-wire system, or midpoint of a single-phase portion of a 3-phase delta system, or a midpoint of a 3-wire, direct-current system.
Conductors shall have a vertical clearance of not less than how many feet above roof surfaces?
Electrical services within the scope of the IRC are limited to ____-volt, 0-to ____- amp, single-phase systems.
Working space in front of panel boards shall not be less than what dimensions?
In clothes closets, surface mounted incandescent luminaires shall have how many inches clearance from the nearest point of storage space when mounted above a door?
The electrical chapters contained in the IRC (34 - 43) do not contain services rated over _____ amps?
Conductors in NM cable assemblies shall be rated at ______ Celsius.
In no case shall the point of attachment for service-drop conductors be less than how much above finish grade?
Over residential property and driveways, service-drop conductors shall have how many feet of clearance above final grade?
Underground wiring shall not be installed under or within the area extending 5 feet horizontally from the inside walls of pools?
Minimum of how many 20 amperes rated branch circuits shall be provided for receptacles located in the laundry area and shall serve only receptacle outlets in the laundry area?
A load where the maximum current is expected to continue for 3 hours or more.
There shall be a wall switch at each floor to control stairway lighting where the stairway has ______ or more risers?
Service drop conductors less than 750 volts to ground shall have a clearance to the base of a diving platform no less than how many feet?
A luminaire facing upward on the bottom of a pool shall have the ______ adequately guarded to prevent contact by any person or shall be listed for use without a guard?
Electrical panel boards and overcurrent devices shall not be located in what kind of location?
Receptacles shall be installed so that no point along the floor line in any wall space is more than how many feet, measured horizontally, from an outlet in that space?
Bonding shall be provided where necessary to ensure electrical ______ and the capacity to conduct safely any fault current likely to be imposed?
The markings for identification of electrical disconnection means and the associated hazards shall have the durability to withstand the ______ involved.
Flexible cords may be installed as a substitute for fixed wiring in a structure when installed in a dropped ceiling?
GFCI protection is required in which area?
In calculating box fill, each 12 AWG conductor shall require how many cubic inches of free space within a box?
Tamper proof receptacles are not required when a receptacle is located more than ______ feet above the floor?

Receptacles that provide power for water-pump motors or other loads directly related to the circulation and sanitation system shall be permitted to be located at least ______ from the inside walls of pools?
Rod and pipe electrodes serving as a grounding electrode shall not be less than how many feet in length?
A minimum of how many 20-ampere-rated branch circuits shall be provided to serve all wall and floor receptacle outlets located in kitchen, pantry, breakfast area, and dining areas?
Constructed or protected so that exposure to a beating rain will not result in the entrance of water under specified test conditions.
Underground feeder cable specified as an allowable wiring method shall be designated as?
Interior metal water piping located more than how many feet from the point of entrance to the building shall not be used as part of the grounding electrode system?
All mechanical elements used to terminate a grounding electrode conductor or bonding jumper to the grounding electrodes shall be what when not buried or concrete encased?
An equipment grounding conductor shall not be used as a grounding electrode conductor?
A ______ minimum length of free conductor shall be provided at each outlet, junction, or switch plate for splicing or termination?
Insulated conductors and cables exposed to direct rays of the sun shall be listed and labeled as what?
Branch circuit conductors for fixed storage type water heaters having a capacity of 120 gallon or less shall be sized no less than ______ percent of the water heater rating?
A minimum of how many 20-ampere branch circuits shall be provided to supply bathroom receptacle outlets?
Except for Type IC luminaires, thermal insulation shall not be installed above a recessed luminaire or within how many inches of the recessed luminaire’s enclosure?
Nonmetallic boxes shall be used only with entirely nonmetallic sheaths, flexible cords and nonmetallic raceways?
Service cables shall be supported by straps or other approved means within ______ of every service head, gooseneck or connection to a raceway or enclosure?
What shall be the minimum burial depth of rigid metal conduit under a parking lot?
Receptacles installed on 15 and 20 ampere rated branch circuits shall be of what type?

For 15- and 20-amp branch circuits, the rating of any-one cord and plug connected piece of utilization equipment, not fastened in place, shall not exceed what percentage of the branch circuit ampere rating?
Connected to establish electrical continuity and conductivity is defined as what?

Where a nonmetallic conduit is installed between a forming shell and a junction box, transformer enclosure, or other enclosure, a ______ AWG insulated copper bonding jumper shall be installed in this conduit except where a listed low-voltage lighting system not requiring grounding is used?
Kitchen countertop receptacles shall be installed so that no point along the wall line is more than how many inches from a receptacle?
The earth shall not be considered as an effective ground-fault current path?

A branch circuit consisting of two or more ungrounded conductors having voltage difference between them, and a grounded conductor having equal voltage difference between it and each ungrounded conductor of the circuit, and that is connected to the neutral or grounded conductor of the system.
The only allowed disconnecting means for an air conditioning condensing unit shall be?
choices: Switch within sight of the appliance
Disconnect within sight of the unit
correct_answer: Disconnect within sight of the unit

question: Copper conductors of 14 AWG in a 10-amp rated circuit shall have a maximum overcurrent protection device rating of what amperage?
Constructed or protected so that exposure to the weather will not interfere with successful operation.
Where subject to physical damage, direct buried conductors shall be protected by schedule 80 PVC rigid nonmetallic conduit or the equivalent?
Not readily accessible to persons unless special means for access are used.
